result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven W. Cleveland

defendant.name: Cleveland, Steven W.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven W. Cleveland
Current: 131 Pierce St, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2017)
Prior: 161 Pierce St., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Steven W. Cleveland
Current: 161 Pierce St., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2017)
Prior: PO Box 232, c/o Jackson Correctional Institution, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to resisting in 15CM306.  Plead no contest to Obstructing in 16CM29.  Remaining counts and 16CM47 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Resisting in 15CM306 and Obstrucing in 16CM29.  Joint recommendation for:  9 months jail each charge, concurrent to each other and to the prison sentence now serving.  Court ordered:  9 months jail each charge, concurrent to each other and to the prison sentence now serving. CC.  Make arrangements by 4/15/17 to set up payment of the CC.     Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
printed out bonds for Attorney Poss to get his client's signature and file with our office.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

of 3/30 PTC notice and 4/18/16 STC notice.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
Attorney Poss requesting signature bond.  State said he already has a signature bond.  Defendant is on a probation hold.  Bond continued with added conditions.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court.  Waive reading.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC 3/30 STC 4/18.  Track with other cases.
